result.execSummary:
The defendant Winfield A. WAAK was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Conspiracy to Manuf/Deliver Cocaine (>15-40g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

timeConds.notes: Perform 100 hours of community service work.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
State files an Amended Information charging Conspiracy to commit manufacture/deliver cocaine (>15-40G), contrary to Section 961.41(1)(cm)3 & 961.41(1x) of the Wisconsin Statutes.   Motion granted.    No contest plea to the amended charge.   Convicted.   Court orders a pre-sentence investigation report to be completed by DOC.   Report is due by 04-01-16.   Sentencing hearing is set for 04-13-16 at 10:30 a.m.   Defendant must submit DNA sample by 5:00 p.m. tomorrow.  
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights.   
Minutes.
Plea date at 02-04-2016 03:30 pm
Plea date at 01-28-2016 10:30 am
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea(s).  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 11-24-15 at 3:45 p.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 11-04-15 at 3:00 p.m.    
Minutes.

Notice of Motion and Motion for Discovery and Inspection; Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
Cover letter.
Authorization to Appear and Act.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody on arrest warrant and appearing by video from Manitowoc County Jail.  The matter is continued for an initial appearance on 10-26-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that she report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, have no contact with Hugo Milan and maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  Bail is furnished and the defendant is released from custody.
Arrest warrant with service of officer thereon.
Minutes.
Warrant served.
Original Bench Warrant returned to Clerk of Court Office because an amended warrant has been issued.
Amended Warrant issued checking box "A".
RE:  Conspiracy to deliver cocaine, between 02-01-15 and 04-03-15.
At 1:00 p.m., search warrant with return of officer thereon.
Affidavit of Investigator Andrew Beck, Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department.
Search warrant issued.  RE:  1440 N. 23rd Street, Manitowoc, WI; occupied by Winfield Waak.
Application for Search Warrant; Warrant; Affidavit in Support of Warrant; Return of Officer. (ORDERED SEALED BY THE COURT)
